----- Original Message -----
From: "John" <buddy1908@...>

The Java HTTP client method of setRequestProperty() is used to set headers -
like Content-Type, Accept, Authorization, User-Agent, etc.
The Java Servlet method of getParameter() is used to get URL query terms for
GET methods and body content for POST methods (where the Content-Type is
'application/x-www-form-urlencoded').
So, you do not use setRequestProperty() in order to have values read by
request.getParameter().

Also, you shouldn't be sending username and password outside of the
Authorization request header - that's what the header is for (unless the
username is not the identifier of the client but some sort of resource
identifier).

You probably also do not want to set doOutput(true) for GET requests.
